description: Gets information about an inference profile. For more information, see Increase throughput and resilience with cross-region inference in Amazon Bedrock. in the Amazon Bedrock User Guide.

parameters.name: inferenceProfileIdentifier
parameters.description: The ID or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the inference profile.

nested_items.name: inferenceProfileName
nested_items.description: The name of the inference profile.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: The description of the inference profile.

nested_items.name: createdAt
nested_items.description: The time at which the inference profile was created.

nested_items.name: updatedAt
nested_items.description: The time at which the inference profile was last updated.

nested_items.name: inferenceProfileArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the inference profile.

nested_items.name: models
nested_items.description: A list of information about each model in the inference profile.

nested_items.name: modelArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the model.

nested_items.name: inferenceProfileId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier of the inference profile.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The status of the inference profile. ACTIVE means that the inference profile is ready to be used.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The type of the inference profile. The following types are possible:
SYSTEM_DEFINED --- The inference profile is defined by Amazon Bedrock. You can route inference requests across regions with these inference profiles.

APPLICATION --- The inference profile was created by a user. This type of inference profile can track metrics and costs when invoking the model in it. The inference profile may route requests to one or multiple regions.
